description: [Status: stable] [Name: suppressible-exception] [Message: Use contextlib.suppress({exception}) instead of try-except-pass] What it does Checks for try-except-pass blocks that can be replaced with the contextlib.suppress context manager. Why is this bad? Using contextlib.suppress is more concise and directly communicates the intent of the code: to suppress a given exception. Note that contextlib.suppress is slower than using try-except-pass directly. For performance-critical code, consider retaining the try-except-pass pattern. Example try: 1 / 0 except ZeroDivisionError: pass Use instead: import contextlib with contextlib.suppress(ZeroDivisionError): 1 / 0
